books.title: A Study in Scarlet
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The self-declared world’s first consulting detective unravels a mysterious case of murder and revenge.

books.title: The House on the Cliff
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: After visiting a suspected haunted house, two brothers and their friends embark on an adventure to see if there’s trouble afoot.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Winnie-the-Pooh
books.author: A. A. Milne
books.summary: A father tells stories to his son about the son’s stuffed animals come to life.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: Philoctetes
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A wounded warrior, abandoned on a deserted island, is visited by former comrades who ask for his help in winning a war.

books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: The Secret Agent
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A spy in London is ordered to stage a bombing to foment political and social chaos.

books.title: The Room in the Dragon Volant
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: After an Englishman traveling in France meets a mysterious woman, he becomes embroiled in a dangerous intrigue.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Mystery of the Blue Train
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A retired detective finds himself at the scene of a murder aboard a French locomotive.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: Some Thoughts Concerning Education
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: John Locke outlines his philosophy of childhood education.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Democracy
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A wealthy New York widow moves to Washington, DC, hoping to get “to the heart of the great American mystery of democracy and government.”

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Clifford D. Simak
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Clifford D. Simak, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: A collection of Selma Lagerlöf’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
